THIS AGREEMENT IS TO AN ELIGIBLE STATE AGENCY TO IMPLEMENT A PROGRAM OF VOLUNTARY TESTING FOR LEAD IN DRINKING WATER AT LOCAL SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE CENTERS. SPECIFICALLY, THE NORTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (NDDEQ) WORKING WITH THE NORTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC INSTRUCTION (NDDPI) AND THE NORTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES (NDDHS)( WILL CONTINUE THE VOLUNTARY LED TESTING IN SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE FACITLIES. THIS WILL INCLUDED UNDERSERVED AND LOW-INCOME COMMUNTIEIS AND MAY INCLUDE FACILITIES THAT ARE OLDER THAN 1988 AND MORE LIKELY TO CONTAIN LEAD PLUMBING, AND FACILITIES THAT CARE FOR CHILDREN AGES SIX YEARS AND YOUNGER.  SCHOOLS, CHILD CARE FACILITIES, THE NDDEQ, THE NDDPI AND THE NDDHS WILL USE EPA'S 3TS GUDIANCE TO COORDINATE A VOLUNTARY LEAD TESTING PROGRAM I SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE FACILTIEIS.  THIS INCLUDES EFFORTS TO 1)  COMMUNICATE; 2)  TRAIN; 3)  TEST AND 4)  TAKE ACTION.

THIS AGREEMENT IS TO AN ELIGIBLE STATE AGENCY TO IMPLEMENT A PROGRAM OF VOLUNTARY TESTING FOR LEAD IN DRINKING WATER AT LOCAL SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE CENTERS. SPECIFICALLY, UTAH DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (UT DEQ) - DIVISION OF DRINKING WATER (DDW) WILL PARTNER WITH LOCAL HEALTH DEPARTMENTS(LHDS) TO CONTACT SCHOOLS THAT CHOSE NOT TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PILOT STUDY TO ENCOURAGE PARTICIPATION AND OFFER TECHNICAL ASSITANCE.  THE MAIN OBJECTIVE IS TO TEST AS MANY CHILD CARE FACILITIES AND SCHOOLS FOR THE PRESENCE OF LEAD IN DRINKING WATER AS POSSIBLE, WHILE PRIORITIZING DISADVANTAGED COMMUNTIES.  UTAH DDW WILL USE THE 3TS GUIDANCE AS A MODEL TO:  1)  COMMUNICATE; 2)  TRAIN; 3)  TEST AND 4)  TAKE ACTION.  ELIGIBLE FACILITIES WILL APPLY TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM.  DDW WILL BE ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS DURING A REQUEST FOR APPLICATION PERIOD FROM NOVEMBER 1, 2019  - JANUARY 31, 2020.

SPECIFICALLY, THE SOUTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND NATURAL RESOURCES (DENR) PLANS TO INITIATE VOLUNTEER TESTING OF THEIR SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE FACILTIEIS.  SDDENR IS PARTNERING WITH THE THIRD PARTY VENDOR, 120 WATER AUDIT (120 WA) TO IMPLEMENT THE LEAD TESTING IS SCHOOLS PROGRAM.  THIS PROGRAM WILL TAKE PLACE FROM FALL 2019 THROUGH SPRING 2020.  120 WA WILL ASSIST SDDENR IN THE LEAD TESTING SCHOOL PROGRAM THROUGH THE USE OF THE 120 WA PLATFORM. 120 WA WAS CHOSEN SOLE SOURCE CONTRACTOR DUE TO THEIR ABILITY TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE SERVICES AS A 'ONE-STOP' SHOP FOR LEAD TESTING IN SCHOOLS. FACILITIES WILL COLLECT SAMPLES AND 120 WA WILL OFFER TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON BEHALF OF SDDENR.

THIS AGREEMENT IS TO AN ELIGIBLE STATE AGENCY TO IMPLEMENT A PROGRAM OF VOLUNTARY TESTING FOR LEAD IN DRINKING WATER AT LOCAL SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE CENTERS. SPECIFICALLY, WYOMING DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL PRIORITIZE THE USE OF FUNDS TO SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE FACILITIES IN UNDERSERVED AND LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES, OLDER FACILITIES (PRE-1988) AND WILL ALSO DIRECT TOWARDS FACILITIES SERVING YOUNGER CHILDREN (THOSE SIX AND UNDER). THIS WILL ALLOW WYDEQ TO:  TRAIN, TEST, TAKE ACTION AND COMMUNICATE.  WYDEQ'S GOAL IS TO REDUCE LEAD EXPOSURE AT THESE FACILITIES TO THE EXTENT POSSIBLE GIVEN AVAILABLE RESOURCES. THIS AGREEMENT IS TO AN ELIGIBLE STATE AGENCY TO IMPLEMENT A PROGRAM OF VOLUNTARY TESTING FOR LEAD IN DRINKING WATER AT LOCAL SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE CENTERS.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL REQUIRE ALL SCHOOLS TO SAMPLE ALL HUMAN CONSUMPTION FIXTURES (HCF) FOR LEAD.  THE GOAL IS TO ASSURE THE SAFETY OF WATER SUPPLIED BY ALL SCHOOLS WITH RESPECT TO LEAD AND TO PROMOTE SAMPLING AND SYSTEM MODIFICATION TO MINIMIZE LEAD EXPOSURE TO CHILDREN AND STAFF.  THE TARGET IS TO REDUCE LEAD LEVELS AVAILABLE FROM A FIXTURE THAT MAY BE USED FOR DRINKING WATER, OR FOR FOOD PREPARATION, TO LESS THAN 5.0 MICROGRAMS PER LITER.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO AID THE MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT (MDE) IN A PROGRAM GEARED TOWARDS THE VOLUNTARY TESTING OF LEAD IN DRINKING WATER AT SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE CENTERS. THIS AGREEMENT IS TO AN ELIGIBLE STATE AGENCY TO IMPLEMENT A PROGRAM OF VOLUNTARY TESTING FOR LEAD IN DRINKING WATER AT LOCAL SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE CENTERS.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL WORK WITH THE TRIBES TO USE EPA&RSQUOANDS 3TS GUIDANCE AS A MODEL TO REDUCE LEAD EXPOSURE TO CHILDREN BY ESTABLISHING A RIGOROUS WATER TESTING PROGRAM FOR TRIBAL CHILD CARE FACILITIES AND K-12 SCHOOLS.  OTHER K-12 PUBLIC, PRIVATE AND PAROCHIAL SCHOOLS WITHIN THEIR BOUNDARIES WHERE TRIBAL CHILDREN ATTEND WILL BE ENCOURAGED TO ENACT A WATER TESTING PROGRAM.  IDEALLY, THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE: 
&BULLAND	TRIBAL HEAD START AND CHILD CARE PROGRAMS FOR PRESCHOOL AGED CHILDREN 
&BULLAND	TRIBAL K-12 SCHOOL OR EDUCATION FACILITIES
&BULLAND	PUBLIC SCHOOLS, KINDERGARTENS, ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, MIDDLE SCHOOLS, HIGH SCHOOLS AND ALTERNATIVE SCHOOLS WITHIN TRIBAL BOUNDARIES WHERE TRIBAL CHILDREN ATTEND

THE ROCKY MOUNTAIN TRIBAL LEADERSHIP COUNCIL (RMTLC) WILL WORK WITH TRIBAL LEADERS AND TRIBAL HEALTH DIRECTORS TO FORM A LOCAL STEERING COMMITTEE TO OVERSEE THE PROJECT IN THEIR COMMUNITY.  THIS COMMITTEE MAY INVOLVE THE TRIBAL EDUCATION DIRECTORS, WATER TREATMENT DEPARTMENTS AND OTHER COMMUNITY MEMBERS. THIS COMMITTEE WILL OVERSEE THE PROJECT AT THE LOCAL LEVELAND ADOPT A BROAD BASED COMMUNICATIONS STRATEGY INFORMING THE TRIBAL PUBLIC ABOUT THE NEED FOR THE PROJECTAND AND ENGAGE K-12 SCHOOLS, HEAD START AND CHILDCARE FACILITIES WITHIN THEIR TRIBAL BOUNDARIES TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROJECT.

THIS AGREEMENT IS TO AN ELIGIBLE STATE AGENCY TO  IMPLEMENT A PROGRAM OF VOLUNTARY TESTING FOR LEAD IN DRINKING WATER AT LOCAL SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE CENTERS.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL THE NDDEQ WILL USE THE PRIORITIES STATED WITHIN THE LEAD TESTING IN SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE PROGRAMS DRINKING WATER GRANT WHICH INCLUDES: 1) FACILITIES OLDER THAN 1988 THAT ARE MORE LIKELY TO CONTAIN LEAD PLUMBING. 2) ALL SCHOOLS AND LARGE GROUP, PRESCHOOL AND MULTI BUILDING DAY CARE FACILITIES THAT CARE FOR CHILDREN AGES SIX YEARS AND YOUNGER 3) SCHOOLS AND LARGE GROUP, PRESCHOOL AND MULTI BUILDING CHILD CARE FACILITIES IN LOW-INCOME AREAS AND/OR DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.  THIS MAY INCLUDE SCHOOLS WITH AT LEAST 50% OF THE CHILDREN RECEIVING FREE AND REDUCED LUNCH AND HEAD START FACILITIES AND 4) ALL SCHOOLS AND ANY OTHER DAY CARE FACILITIES WHO WANT TO HAVE THEIR FACILITY TESTED FOR LEAD IN DRINKING.  NOTIFICATION REGARDING THE VOLUNTARY PROGRAM WILL BE MADE TO THESE SCHOOL AND LARGE GROUP, PRESCHOOL AND MULTI BUILDING CHILD CARE FACILITY ADMINISTRATORS BY THE NDDPI AND THE NDDHS.  THE NOTIFICATION WILL BE AN EMAIL WHICH WILL CONTAIN EITHER A SCHOOL LEAD HAZARDS SURVEY OR A CHILD CARE FACILITIES LEAD HAZARD SURVEY FOR THESE FACILITIES TO COMPLETE. THE SURVEYS WILL BE RETURNED TO THE NDDEQ FOR EVALUATION. IT WILL BE THE NDDEQ GOAL TO COMMUNICATE INFORMATION REGARDING THE PROGRAM TO 40 FACILITIES.  USING THE PRIORITIES LISTED ABOVE, IT IS THE NDDEQ GOAL TO REDUCE LEAD EXPOSURE AT THESE FACILITIES. THE NDDEQ WILL: A. DETERMINE WHICH SCHOOLS AND LARGE GROUP PRESCHOOLS AND MULTI BUILDING CHILD CARE FACILITIES, LOCATED IN LOW-INCOME OR DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, HAVE THE GREATEST POTENTIAL FOR LEAD CONTAMINATION BY IDENTIFYING POTENTIAL LEAD SOURCES, PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THESE FACILITIES REGARDING SAMPLING AT APPROVED OUTLETS, AND RECOMMEND POSSIBLE OPTIONS FOR REMEDIATION IF ELEVATED LEAD LEVELS ARE IDENTIFIED. B. PROVIDE EDUCATION ABOUT LEAD AND THE IMPORTANCE OF TESTING FOR LEAD TO ANY SCHOOL OR CHILD CARE FACILITY USING THE EPA 3TS GUIDANCE AND INFORMATION ON THE NDDEQ LEAD IN SCHOOLS WEBSITE. C. ASSIST SCHOOL OR CHILD CARE FACILITIES THAT VOLUNTEERS FOR THE GRANT PROGRAM WITH SAMPLING.  FACILITIES MAYBE ALLOWED TO PERFORM THEIR OWN SAMPLING AT APPROVED SAMPLE SITES USING THE EPA 3TS GUIDANCE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS WIIN 2107 GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO AID THE PENNSYLVANIA INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AUTHORITY (PENNVEST) IN IMPLEMENTING A PROGRAM FOR VOLUNTARY TESTING AND REMEDIATION OF LEAD IN DRINKING WATER AT SCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE CENTERS. PENNVEST WILL USE AVAILABLE FUNDS TO CONDUCT OUTREACH, PUBLIC EDUCATION, SAMPLING OF THE DRINKING WATER, AND REMEDIATION OF LEAD WHERE THERE ARE LEAD EXCEEDANCES. 
ACTIVITIES:UNDER THE WIIN 2107 GRANT, PENNVEST WILL OFFER EDUCATIONAL AND SAMPLING MATERIALS CONCERNING LEAD IN DRINKING WATER AND TESTING FOR LEAD CONTAMINATION IN DRINKING WATER AT SCHOOLS AND CHILDCARE CENTERS. PENNVEST HAS PARTNERED WITH A THIRD-PARTY CONTRACTOR, TERRAPHASE ENGINEERING, AS WELL AS UTILIZING KNOWLEDGE FROM OTHER STATE AGENCIES. PENNVEST WILL WORK WITH SCHOOL ADMINISTRATORS, CHILD CARE PROGRAM OWNERS, AND/OR CONTRACTORS TO DEVELOP SAMPLE SITE PLANS. LEAD SAMPLING WILL OCCUR AT FACILITIES IDENTIFIED BY THEIR PRIORITIZATION. THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL) ALLOWS ALL EXISTING, UNUSED ALLOCATIONS, AND FUTURE ALLOCATIONS OF THIS GRANT PROGRAM TO BE USED FOR REMEDIATION PURPOSES. PENNVEST WILL USE THIS ALLOCATION TO FUND REMEDIATION IN THE CASE OF LEAD EXCEEDANCES. EXAMPLES OF REMEDIATION INCLUDE THE REPLACEMENT OF INTERNAL PLUMBING, FAUCETS, WATER FOUNTAINS, WATER FILLER STATIONS, POU DEVICES, LSLS OR CONNECTORS, AND OTHER LEAD-FREE APPARATUS RELATED TO DRINKING WATER. PENNVEST WILL SUBMIT ADDITIONAL DETAILS AND UPDATED WORK PLANS BASED ON THE REMEDIATION NEEDS OF SCHOOLS AND CHILDCARE PROGRAMS. THEY ARE CURRENTLY REFINING THEIR CURRENT CONTRACT TO INCLUDE REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES.
